blog.description: a tyrus/ambiris/bandi/jibby stan blog basically, hope you enjoy your stay! Oh dear its a sideblog. Nickname is TJ occasionally ghostie. they/them. 16. lesbian here. Ugh have you seen tjskipping? Unfair that she is so amazing <3 Ask box is always open! Prompts or just talking :). Credit to creators of header (jonahbex) and icon (wlwambris)!

summary: the inexhaustible variety of life
body:
the inexhaustible variety of life

summary: Cyrus Goodman has isolated himself from the rest of his prep school, but will an easygoing transfer student manage to crack his shell?

pairing: tyrus

word count of chapter: 845 (sorry i suck at writing long chapters ok)

first chapter, previous chapter

—————————

chapter 3: nerd

At this point, TJ isn’t sure if Cyrus actually hasn’t noticed or is just playing coy, but it’s blatantly obvious to any bystanders that TJ has slowly made his way across the classroom throughout the past two weeks to try and get closer to Cyrus’ spot.

His excuse? Cyrus is constantly scribbling in his books during class, and sometimes doesn’t even notice the bell rang dismissing them all. TJ simply just wants to see the inside and read his analyses. That’s it. Nothing at all to do with the fact that maybe he wants to run his hands through the chocolate brown hair of his or make those dark eyes stop being so cold. Nope. At least, that’s what he would say if you asked about it.

Especially if you’re Amber.

“You’re so in denial,” Amber sighed, taking a seat across from him in the practically empty library.

“I’m not in denial if there’s nothing to deny,” TJ retorted, leaning back in his chair.

Amber furrowed her eyebrows. “That doesn’t even make any sense.”

The door to the library opened behind TJ then, making Amber glance to see who was entering. Amber gave them a small smile and a shy wave, which caused TJ to turn around to see who the hell rose that reaction out of the blonde.

He turned to see a pixie haired girl sporting a pink headband along with a few pins on the mandatory uniform making her way to the textbook section. “Who’s that?” TJ asked, turning back to face Amber.

Amber coughed. “That’s Andi, from my biology class.”

“Andi, huh?” TJ smirked.

Amber crossed her arms, now on the defensive. “It’s not like that.”

“Looks like I’m not the one in denial,” TJ teased.

Amber just swatted his shoulder.

•••

The fated day had finally arrived.

TJ was actually close enough to read whatever Cyrus was scribbling in the latest book he’d picked up.

TJ leaned forward just a bit in order to catch the name of the book, and immediately grew ecstatic when he saw the familiar cover of A Streetcar Named Desire, his personal favorite play. He had to see what was being written in those margins.

So, instead of being a normal person and try to forget about it because it’s totally not his place, he did the most TJ thing possible and started formulating his plan.

•••

TJ knocked on Cyrus’ door, knowing this definitely wasn’t his brightest idea, but he was going through with it anyway because, well, maybe he actually didn’t know yet. Whatever.

Cyrus didn’t even finish opening the door when TJ held up his own copy of the play and said, “I can’t stand a naked lightbulb, any more than I can a rude remark or vulgar action.”

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows. “What? I mean, I know that’s a quote, but—“

“It’s one of my favorite plays,” TJ explains, “and I bet it’s one of yours too.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes and crossed his arms in true Cyrus fashion. “Why are you so insistent on talking to me about literature?”

TJ sighed, a small smile having not left his face throughout the entire conversation. “Because I’m sure you like it, whether you want to admit it or not.” He leaned in, adding, “Don’t worry, I won’t tell your chess buddies.”

Cyrus simply squinted and opened his door a bit more. “Are you gonna come in or not?”

TJ walked into the dorm room, marveling at all of the various literature themed posters adorning the walls. “Wow,” he said. “And you called me a nerd.”

“I am not a nerd!” Cyrus retorted. “I just… have passions.”

TJ chuckled. “I’m just teasing. It’s nice to finally meet someone who likes literature as much as me.”

TJ looked over at Cyrus then with a soft gaze, and he couldn’t help but think that for a split second, Cyrus did the same.

They stood there for a moment, until Cyrus turned away to grab his copy of Streetcar, handing it to the taller boy. “Since you’re so interested in what I’ve been thinking about these books, you can read it for yourself.”

“Are you sure?” TJ asked, “I don’t want to be invading anything.” He thought back to the week and a half of him trying to peer over to look at Cyrus’ desk. Yeah, that line was crossed a long time ago.

“I’m sure. Just as long as you tell me what you think too,” Cyrus said, the smallest ghost of a teasing smile on his face.

TJ scratched the back of his neck. “Maybe we could, like, discuss it or something?”

Cyrus took a glance at his desk and winced. “I… can’t right now, my physics teacher is a bitch and he assigned us 30 pages of textbook notes for tomorrow. Maybe another time?”

TJ, the ever hopeful, replied, “I get it. What about Saturday?”

It was apparent Cyrus hadn’t expected TJ to come up with an actual day, considering the confused face he made, but still he softened and replied, “Yeah. Saturday.”

the inexhaustible variety of life

body:
hey if you like tyrus then boy do i have the ship for you!! aris and temo are two teenagers from the mexican telenovela mi marido tiene más familia (my husband has more family) and you can watch their storyline with english subtitles here!!

Aristemo Story

summary: Request: Cyrus and Jonah are hanging out at Jonahs house and One of Jonah's family members walks into the room looks at Cyrus...
question: Request: Cyrus and Jonah are hanging out at Jonahs house and One of Jonah's family members walks into the room looks at Cyrus and says "you know Jonah you are right he is cute" then walks away
answer:
Jonah doesn’t bring Cyrus over that often, mostly because that whenever he does, his older brother always feels the need to obnoxiously embarrass him to no end. If Cyrus didn’t know that Jonah felt something for him before, then he has to know now, thanks to all of Pedro’s stupid comments that have been made over time. In fact, they were from so long ago-six months, at least-that Jonah is hoping that Cyrus has forgotten.

He hasn’t. Hell, he thinks about the instances every other day, but it’s not like he tells him that. Jonah would think he was ridiculous, just like he would think Jonah’s ridiculous for feeling this crazy about him.

Okay, neither would think the other were crazy. They’d be pretty stoked.

Again, though, no way in hell would they admit that.

When Jonah takes Cyrus up to his room, it’s nice to know that Pedro won’t be back from tutoring for at least a few hours, which Cyrus currently doesn’t know about.

“Where’s Pedro?”

“Oh. Study group.”

“Do you know when he’ll be back?” Cyrus asks.

“Not till late. He’s annoying, I know.” Jonah briskly laughs.

“Nah, he’s hilarious.” Cyrus smiles, making Jonah turn bright red and fear that Cyrus thinks that because he might see what Pedro says about the two of them to be far from true.

“Yeah, you think?” Jonah scoffs, grinning at the sound of Cyrus’ giggle.

What he’s not laughing at, though, is the sound of Pedro’s obnoxious footsteps sprinting up the staircase, and running over to Jonah’s door which he flings open.

“Get out!!” Jonah screams instantaneously.

“WOW JONAH, YOU’RE RIGHT, HE IS CUTE.” Pedro screams loudly.

“SHUT UP!” Jonah shouts over Pedro’s cackling, stomping over and shoving him back into the hall, slamming the door in his face and making sure to lock it.

The fact that Cyrus is practically snickering isn’t making Jonah’s turmoil any easier.

Once he can tell that Pedro is gone, he feels it’s safe to speak. “Um…He doesn’t think you’re cute.” That, he can be honest about.

“Okay.” Cyrus laughs, smiling at the redness shining on Jonah’s cheeks. “Do you, though…?”

He has a feeling that Jonah thinks he’s more than ‘cute’ if Pedro was so reliant on teasing him about their friendship.

“So what if I did?” Jonah defends. “Am I not allowed to acknowledge the attractiveness of other guys?”

“So, you think I’m attractive.” Cyrus states.

“Yeah, well, you are…” Jonah tries to carelessly play it off with a shrug.

“Well, so are you.”

Jonah can’t stop himself from blushing harder, or tightening up. “Thanks.” He flashes a smile, wiping away the sweat from his face, only growing more embarrassed when Cyrus chuckles.

“That’s not all you are, though.” Cyrus continues.

“Really?” Jonah’s heart stutters at the thought of him elaborating.

“Yeah. I mean, c’mon, you’re funny, and clever, and, maybe a little oblivious-“

They both laugh.

“But, yeah.” Cyrus beams. “I like you…” He sees no shame in admitting it, considering he’s pretty sure that Jonah likes him too. Pedro couldn’t have made all those comments for no absolute reason. Plus, with how intrigued and blissful Jonah acts around him, it all adds up.

Instead of words, Jonah responds with a kiss to his lips, one that goes on for as long as they can manage, repeating the process several more times and getting more lost in the moment the longer it lasts.

In the middle of grinning and pecking each other repeatedly, just as Jonah wraps his arms around him, Cyrus’ phone rings, causing them to break apart and look to each other in despair, before Cyrus answers his mother, who requests he come home.

“Sorry.” Cyrus is apologizing to Jonah after he’s hung up. “I totally forgot that she needs me to join her.”

“Like how I forgot Pedro would be coming home sooner than expected?” Jonah smiles, making Cyrus scoff.

“Yeah. Like that. Maybe it’s best that he did.” He gets Jonah to think about it, and come to conclusion that Cyrus is absolutely right.

“I walk you out?” He offers.

Cyrus proudly takes his hand.

Down in the kitchen, Pedro can’t help but notice that not only are Jonah and Cyrus’ shoulders touching, but they’re walking hand in hand and beaming at each other on the way to the front door.

Saying their final goodbyes, they share a gratifying hug, Cyrus and Pedro exchanging smile smiles while temporarily facing each other’s directions.

After Jonah watches Cyrus walk out the door, he shuts it closed, instantly sprinting over to Pedro and giving him the biggest squeeze of all.

“Thank you.”

Behind his teasing, was always the best of intentions.
